Zhijian Yang

AI for Healthcare

About

I am a fourth-year Ph.D. student in Applied Math and Computational Science at the University of Pennsylvania, advised by Christos Davatzikos. My research interests lie in AI for healthcare, with specific focuses on generative model, representation learning, and multi-modal learning. Throughout my Ph.D. study, I primarily focused on developing deep learning models for disentangling disease heterogeneity. Specifically, we tackled the problem from the following three methodological perspectives

  • Patient Clustering based on disease-related imaging patterns
  • Learning interpretable dimensional representaiton of disease-related imaging patterns
  • Multi-modal disease subtyping with imaging and genetic signatures

    • For future research, I am still interested in machine learning and deep learning for medical research. I am particularly interested in summarizing high dimensional medical data into interpretable indices which could ()

    Projects

    Deep learning methods for disentangling brain disease heterogeneity


  • Method 1: Smile-GAN - Patient clustering based on disease-related imaging patterns
  • Method 2: Surreal-GAN - Interpretable latent representaiton of disease-related imaging patterns
  • Method 3: Gene-SGAN - Multi-modal disease subtyping via imaging and genetic signatures
